intro: Viola cotyledon, commonly known as the common violet, is a herbaceous perennial plant belonging to the Violaceae family. It is characterized by its heart-shaped, velvety leaves and clusters of fragrant, five-petaled flowers that range in color from purple to white. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and thrives in moist, well-drained soils in temperate climates. Its cotyledons, the first pair of seed leaves, are a key feature in its early growth stage. The plant is often cultivated for ornamental purposes and has historical uses in herbal medicine.
